intro: Evacopsis discolor, commonly known as the variable sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Evacopsis discolor is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
